intro: Gynostemma yixingense, commonly known as the Yixing gynostemma, is a rare climbing herb native to China. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by edible, pear-shaped fruits. It is valued for its potential medicinal properties and is often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
